Title: Quality Assurance Auditor
RoleDescription:
About the Team 
DoorDashs Customer Experience Insights (CXI) Quality Assurance team safeguards the consistency and excellence of every support interaction. As a QA Auditor, youll combine a meticulous eye for detail with a data-driven mindset to champion quality across a global network of teammates and sites.
Collaborate with the Quality Supervisor to refine QA processes, elevate training and content, and drive initiatives that boost teammate efficiency, productivity, and policy adherence, enhancing the overall DoorDash Support experience. 
At DoorDash, we believe in fostering a culture of meaningful connection, collaboration, and professional growth through in-office interactions. This position requires an in-office presence at the DoorDash corporate office in Tempe and the employee must live within a commutable 50 miles from the office. In-office days are determined by the business and can change based on business needs. Connect with the recruiter to determine what the in-office requirement for this role is.
About the Role 

Serve as first-line guidance for Teammates via audit completion, supplying actionable feedback
Attend recurring calibration sessions with operations partners to stay aligned on scoring standards and surface trends to leadership
Deliver ad-hoc deep-dives and root-cause analyses (RCA), summarizing findings in clear project-management (PM) recaps
Maintain expert knowledge of top contact drivers by line of business (LOB) and share weekly priority focus areas to keep stakeholders aligned
Recommend updates to training, knowledge articles, and SOPs to elevate the DoorDash Support experience
Train and mentor new auditors, reinforcing best practices and efficiency tools

You should be excited about this opportunity because... 

Your insights directly influence customer and Dasher satisfaction, shaping how millions experience DoorDash support.
You will work side-by-side with global Quality peers and cross-functional partners who value data-backed recommendations.
You will be able to speak to and potentially lead key quality initiatives, manage deliverables, and refine processes that boost productivity and policy adherence.
You thrive on precision, love turning data into action, and want to elevate customer experience at scale.

Were excited about you because... 

Minimum 1-year Quality Auditor experience within DoorDash
Experience supporting multiple lines of business
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently
Well-organized and attentive to detail 
Analytical and data-driven; root cause analysis is your specialty 
Impeccable follow-up and follow-through capabilities 
Ability to excel in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment 
Time Management while driving multiple deadlines simultaneously 
Have an owner mentality; you're focused on quality, output-driven, an extreme hustler, proactive, 
You demonstrate an understanding of 1% better  

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash... 

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies. 
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. 
We are learning - Were not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if its scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, whether weve been in a role for one year or one minute. 
We are customer-obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility. 
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together, making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights. 
We offer great compensation packages and comprehensive health benefits.

Title: Shift Lead - Grandview
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Benefits

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Title: Manager, Sales - In Store, SevenRooms
Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; Chicago, IL; Washington D.C.; Seattle, WA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The SMB Sales team has been the face of DoorDash to our merchant partners since our founding in 2013. Stationed locally, this team creates deep partnerships with local and regional merchants in any given geography. The Commerce Platform team specifically is on a mission to redefine and reshape the hospitality industry for restaurant operators both on and off the DoorDash delivery marketplace. We are disrupting the current landscape by opening the door for hospitality operators to a new frontier of streamlined operations, customer insights and relationship management across all channels -  from walk-in to at home delivery.  
Following the recent acquisition of SevenRooms by DoorDash, we maintain a unified hiring processplease inform your recruiter if youve applied to either company previously to avoid duplicate applications.
About the Role
As a Sales Manager for our In Store business, you will be responsible for leading a team of regional Account Executives, driving the sales performance to both existing and new DoorDash restaurant partners and is the main input to the growth of our In Store business You do this through hiring, developing, and performance managing great talent, as well as building an inclusive and motivating work environment. As an early member of our growing business line, you will be asked to help build the foundational components of our sales motion to scale globally.  This position will report to the Senior Manager, Sales - In Store and will lead team members in key strategic markets in the US. This role will be remote but will require travel to your key markets for both organization and restaurant sales support as needed.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build and Grow a High-Performing Team: You'll be responsible for sourcing, interviewing, and hiring top talent to scale the team, while also assessing team strengths and weaknesses to provide tailored management.
Drive Strategic Sales Performance and Regional Integration: You will actively support front-line sellers, ensuring consistent input quality, coaching for success, and assisting on critical deals while integrating the sales team with regional goals.
Lead with Empathy and Effective Communication: You'll foster a positive team environment in a high-volume, fast-paced role, acting as a supportive leader and ensuring high morale.
Contribute to DoorDash's Growth and Culture: You'll play a vital role in the company's expansion in the US and Canada, embodying DoorDash's values of leadership, operation, learning, and teamwork to directly impact the company's success.

Were excited about you because...

You have a minimum of 3 years in sales leadership positions with experience in SaaS, SMB Tech or Restaurant Sales
You have a track record of building and growing a high-performing sales team, capable of sourcing and developing top talent.
You have consistently achieved and overperformed on strategic sales goals
You're committed to leading with empathy and effective communication, fostering a positive and motivating team environment.
You're eager to contribute significantly to DoorDash's growth and culture, embodying our core values and impacting the company's success in the US.
You have experience working directly with restaurants and hospitality groups, understanding their needs and identifying gaps in their operations.
Youre able to work with a cross-functional team and guarantee a smooth transition for new restaurant partners.
You are comfortable with sales tools like Salesforce, Google Suite and general data analysis.

Were a rapidly growing team of Engineers, Scientists and builders on a mission to fundamentally transform the hospitality industry. This role reports directly to an Engineering Manager.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance

About the Team
The Outside Sales team has been the face of DoorDash to our merchant partners since our founding in 2013. Stationed locally, this team creates deep partnerships with the most coveted local and regional restaurants in any given geography. Our Outside Sales team is the revenue driving arm of DoorDash and ensures the growth of our SMB partnerships which help strengthen operations, accelerate consumer growth, and improve our bottom line.
This is a field sales opportunity based out of the cities specified above. You will need to live in or in proximity to the market.

We are looking for a Strategic Merchant Lead (Senior Territory Account Executive) for the Outside Sales team to establish partnerships with our Local Hero and Local Premium merchants across the region. The key to DoorDashs growth is merchant selection. The more local hero and local premium merchants we add to DoorDash, the faster we will add new customers, the better we will retain existing customers, and the higher our conversion rates will be for customers visiting our app or website.
You'll be focused on new restaurant acquisitions with a transactional deal cycle and bringing on the best local and regional restaurants onto the DoorDash platform. You will prospect, meet with, and close partnerships with these merchants. Youll report into our Strategic Sales Manager on our Outside Sales team, where you'll have direct access to all you'll need to grow your career to the next level.
This is a field sales role based in the specified cities above. You will spend some time traveling in the region meeting with merchants (2-3 days per week) and spend some time remote. In addition, this role will require the ability to travel as needed for in-person collaboration through trainings, offsites, team-building events, and other business related necessity.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Have a passion for SMB businesses and the restaurant industry
Sell restaurant owners on the value of partnering with DoorDash and help them understand the value of our full suites of services (e.g. Marketplace, Storefront, Dashpass)
Lead complex negotiations to structure industry-leading and mutually beneficial economic terms
Excel in a transactional deal cycle and closing new business within a few weeks
Use creative strategies in sales processes and prospect outreach
Share on-the-ground insights with sales leadership and operations team
Mentor teammates on how to be the best version of themselves after establishing yourself in the role
Travel into different markets and meet with restaurant owners (hybrid role with up to 50% travel)

We're excited about you because...

You have 3+ years of experience in a closing sales role or related experience
You excel in a transactional deal cycle
You have experience exceeding goals
You have experience selling multi-product solutions
You approach challenges from the fundamentals
You express creative sales tactics to engage with prospects
You have experience using a CRM (Salesforce) and Google Apps

As one of DoorDash's core operations teams, Customer Experience and Support Ops, we ensure that when there are bumps in the last mile, there's always someone there to help make things right. Our team designs and manages DoorDash's large and growing global network of support centers to create the best customer experiences, with the ultimate goal of delivering an outstanding customer experience as reliably as possible.
About the Role
We are looking for a Disaster Prevention Specialist, who will work in partnership with the Advanced Customer Escalations (ACE) team, to intervene on our most challenging customer experiences whether Dasher, Merchant or Consumer. 
As a Disaster Prevention Specialist, you will help us to retain and save our customers during an experience that could head towards disaster. Although we always try to make it right, we know there are still instances that a customers support experience could go off track and we want to prevent these Disasters. Youll take ownership of these issues no matter the challenge to bring the customers issue to resolution and then help us become 1% better every day by understanding the cause.
You will have demonstrated experience delivering effective execution and communication. Youll be excited to solve one of our most challenging problems within a newly scoped program within support. 
Once our offices reopen, we expect this role to be hybrid with some time in-office and some time remote
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

    Collaborate and troubleshoot on important issues for Consumers, Merchants and Dashers 
    Partner with teams to understand root cause and recommendations on how to prevent in the future
    Operate well with ambiguity when the ideal solution may not be outlined
    Develop an expertise in how DoorDash's systems and resources work, and how to use them to promote positive outcomes for our Customers
    Validate and track customer feedback to inform updates to our products and tools

We're excited about you because... 

    3 or more years of experience with account management, customer support, hospitality or in related field
    High School Degree or GED required. Bachelors degree preferred.
    Knowledge of  Salesforce (or other CRM software), and the ability to view and interpret dashboards.
    Basic proficiency with Microsoft Suite and Google Suite
    Basic knowledge of Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) tools and formatting functionality.
    Experience with SQL
    Experience advocating for customer experience within a team or initiative
    You excel at building relationships
    You excel at determining prioritization
    You're creative
    You love thinking about new opportunities for process improvement

Title: DashMart Team Member - Garden City
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Were excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties, including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

About the Team
DoorDashs Legal team has built a strong reputation within the company for our highly collaborative and supportive approach to counseling, always with a bias for action. DoorDash is seeking a talented attorney with experience in insurance and/or personal injury litigation to join our growing legal team. The Insurance Litigation Counsel will be responsible for handling and managing a docket of litigated and pre-litigated matters. Candidates should have strong attention to detail, be execution oriented, have high business acumen, excellent analytical and writing skills, and should be enthusiastic, well organized, a team player, and self-motivated. Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Manage a growing docket of personal injury and interpersonal matters.
Strategize on scalable processes and procedures for efficient and consistent handling of personal injury matters.
Preparing and responding to discovery and dispositive motions. 
Work with outside counsel to ensure consistent and effective handling and reporting of information from ongoing personal injury matters.
Manage all aspects of outside counsel relationships, including litigation strategy, work product, and budgets.

Were excited about you because...

You have a J.D.
You have 4+ years of experience at a leading law firm and/or in-house legal department, handling insurance litigation, coverage issues, and/or pre-litigation disputes.

You have a positive attitude (no task is too big or too small!)

Prior in-house experience at a technology or gig economy company.

Title: Account Executive
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The In-Store SMB Sales team at DoorDash is amplifying SevenRooms mission to redefine and reshape the hospitality industry for restaurant operators around the globe. Our Account Executives are trusted advisors and expert relationship-builders, approaching every conversation with potential clients in a consultative manner to identify their existing business gaps and think creatively to present the perfect solution. We are changing the current landscape by opening the door for hospitality operators to truly own their guest relationships, reducing dependency on 3rd party networks, and streamlining operations.
About the Role
As a Senior Account Executive, you'll work directly with restaurants and hospitality groups to identify gaps in their current tools, recommending the appropriate In-Store Platform solutions including reservation, waitlist & table management, Online Ordering for delivery & pickup, marketing automation, and more. This role is necessary to the success of empowering hospitality operators everywhere to excel, be inspired, and deliver magical guest experiences every day. You will add new restaurants to our platform while collaborating with operational teams to support onboarding and foster relationships to guarantee smooth transitions.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Develop a pipeline of restaurants and hospitality groups. Focus on restaurant acquisition while building strong relationships with partners and advocating for client success.
Master the value proposition of our In-Store platform. Help operators understand how we can help their business through consultative sales approaches and creative solution presentation.
Conduct meetings and demos both virtually and in person when applicable. Deliver compelling presentations that showcase our platform's capabilities and business impact.
Own 100% of the sale from prospecting through to go-live. Handle pitching, negotiation, contracts, live product demonstrations, follow-ups, and agreement signing in the full sales cycle.
Build relationships with your partners and always advocate for client success. Act as a trusted advisor who ensures long-term partnership success and smooth onboarding transitions.

Were excited about you because...

You have 3+ years of hospitality technology or B2B SaaS sales experience with proven track record of hitting and exceeding quota while managing senior-level targets
You have face-to-face and virtual presentation capability with the ability to work autonomously both in-office and remotely
You are technologically savvy with a desire to learn new tools and perform daily responsibilities with a drive for results
You have experience with Salesforce, Outreach, and equivalent tools with restaurant/hospitality experience being a plus
You are willing to travel into core markets periodically and approach every client conversation with a consultative mindset to identify business gaps and present creative solutions

About the Team
The In-Store (SevenRooms) Sales Team is on a mission to reshape the hospitality industry by empowering restaurant operators to take control of their guest relationships. We take a consultative approach to every conversationhelping clients uncover business gaps, streamline operations, and reduce reliance on third-party platforms. Our team is made up of driven, thoughtful sales professionals who act as trusted advisors and long-term partners to hospitality businesses around the world.
About the Role
As an Associate Manager, youll lead a team of Account Executives, coaching and developing talent while helping scale our sales organization. Youll bring deep experience in running complex, consultative sales cycles and use that knowledge to support your team in closing high-impact deals. In this role, youll play a key part in growing our customer base and driving the success of hospitality operators using the SevenRooms platform.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead and Develop the Team. Assess individual strengths, provide regular performance feedback, and support your team with weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting.
Hire Top Talent. Source, interview, and hire high-performing salespeople as the team continues to grow.
Support Key Deals. Assist your team in strategic sales opportunitiesfrom prospecting and outreach to sales deck creation, presentations, and closing.
Own Regional Performance. Ensure your team is staffed and performing to meet regional revenue goals and sales targets.
Standardize Sales Practices. Create and scale best practices, strategies, and programs that increase team efficiency and sales impact.
Build Strong Customer Relationships. Partner with clients to understand their needs and foster long-term, trusted relationships.

Were excited about you because...

Youre an inspiring leader who knows how to motivate and support geographically distributed teams.
Youre action-oriented and thrive in fast-paced, ever-changing environments.
You have 2+ years of SaaS sales experience, with a strong record of exceeding your goals (CRM sales experience a plus).
You bring 3+ years of sales management experience, ideally in a high-growth or startup environment.
Youre tech-savvy and comfortable using tools like Salesforce, Gong.io, and Google Workspace.
Youre passionate about hospitality and excited to help operators succeed.

Title: Territory Account Executive - Idaho
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Outside Sales team has been the face of DoorDash to our merchant partners since our founding in 2013. Stationed locally, this team creates deep partnerships with the most coveted local and regional restaurants in any given geography. Our Outside Sales team is the revenue driving arm of DoorDash and ensures the growth of our SMB partnerships which help strengthen operations, accelerate consumer growth, and improve our bottom line.
This is a field sales opportunity based out of the cities specified above. You will need to live in or in proximity to the market.
About the Role
As a Regional Merchant Lead (Outside Sales Representative), you'll join a team of experienced sales professionals who have excelled in the art of leading deliberate sales processes. You'll be focused on new restaurant acquisition with a transactional deal cycle and bringing on the best local and regional restaurants onto the DoorDash platform. In this role you will prospect, meet with, and close partnerships with these restaurants  selling new products and services to them while also uncovering their pain points. Youll report into our sales leadership, you'll have direct access to all you'll need to grow your career to the next level.
This is a field sales role based in the specified cities above. You will spend some time traveling in the region meeting with merchants and spend some time remote. In addition, this role will require the ability to travel as needed for in-person collaboration through trainings, offsites, team-building events, and other business related necessity.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Have a passion for SMB businesses and the restaurant industry
Sell restaurant owners on the value of partnering with DoorDash and negotiate revenue share agreements
Excel in a transactional deal cycle and closing new business within days
Use creative strategies in sales processes and prospect outreach
Share on-the-ground insights with sales leadership and operations team
Mentor teammates on how to be the best version of themselves after establishing yourself in the role
Travel into different markets and meet with restaurant owners (hybrid role with up to 50% travel)

We're excited about you because...

You have 2+ years of experience in a closing sales role
You excel in a transactional deal cycle
You have experience exceeding goals
You have experience selling multi-product solutions
You approach challenges from the fundamentals
You express creative sales tactics to engage with prospects
You have experience using a CRM (Salesforce) and Google Apps

Title: Sr. Contracts Manager, Legal
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The DoorDash legal team has built a strong reputation within the company for our confident, supportive approach to in-house legal counseling, always with a bias for action. Our north star is helping our business drive growth, and we deeply value growing together as a team. Most of all, we are passionate about constantly improving our practice and what we have built as a company.
About the Role
DoorDash is hiring an exceptional, business-minded negotiator to join our Legal team. We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented candidate to oversee the lifecycle of contracts across the organization. The ideal candidate will be responsible for drafting, reviewing, negotiating, and managing various types of contracts to ensure compliance with legal requirements, company policies, and business goals.  Youll work on a wide variety of deal types, many of which enable DoorDash to open new routes to market.
Were looking for an experienced contracts negotiator with a strong work ethic, excellent analytical and communication skills, who thrives in a fast paced environment. The ideal candidate will be creative and curious, is a self-starter who takes ownership over initiatives, and is hands-on taking into consideration the lowest level of detail. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Draft, negotiate and examine a broad range of customer-facing agreements, such as DoorDash & SevenRooms merchant agreements, SaaS agreements, as well as various ancillary agreements. 
Assist in the creation of training and enablement documentation to drive efficient interaction between the Legal team and other departments.
Support legal operations regarding contract lifecycle management and other tools, including creating approval workflows for access and tracking performance metrics.
Partner with finance, deal desk, tax, privacy and security, and other internal stakeholder teams to ensure negotiated agreements are consistent with internal policies.
Join a close-knit, caring team of outstanding professionals.

Were excited about you because you...

Have experience supporting contracts for a fast- paced sales organization. 
Bring deep experience drafting and negotiating a large volume of contracts, and have demonstrated the ability to manage multiple contract deadlines
Have a strong understanding of contract law, legal terminology.
Have excellent negotiation and communication skills, as well as a high attention to detail and strong organizational abilities.
Work autonomously and exercise sound judgment in a fast-paced environment.
Have a proven ability to balance legal risk and business objectives.
Proficiency with Contract Lifecycle Management systems and similar workflow tools preferred, but not required.
Foster empathy, collaboration, and mutual respect in your practice, and you default toward assuming good intentions about others.
Are curious, humble (no task is too big or too small), andthrough it alldont take yourself too seriously.
Are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment and have prioritized participating in DEI initiatives in past roles.
Hold a Bachelor's degree (JD or paralegal certification a plus).
Bring a minimum of 7 years of experience in contract management, legal, or paralegal roles.

Title: DashMart Team Member - Lenexa
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.

Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs is an independent team within DoorDash. We explore robotics and automation to transform last-mile logistics in the long term. If you have a passion for applying cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and enhance delivery experiences for millions of users, we want to talk to you!
The Drone Delivery team is focused on bringing the dream of fast, efficient, and delightful last mile delivery through the air to life. As one of the leaders in this space, we believe strongly in the promise of combining advanced robotics, aviation, and operational innovation to bring this high flying technology into our 3-sided marketplace. We are a team of doers, heavily focused on bringing our products and visions to market. 
About the Role 
Were expanding the drone team! Are you an engineer passionate about using UAV technology to reimagine logistics? Do you thrive in developing and deploying state-of-the-art systems in real-world environments? Do you love getting your hands dirty and turning large visions into practical realities? If so, we want to talk to you!
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Design and implement backend services for autonomous drone delivery that integrates with core DoorDash data, focusing on intelligent path planning, real-time fleet management, and dynamic airspace awareness.
Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and fault-tolerant systems to manage a fleet of delivery drones, ensuring safe and efficient operations.
Implement simulations and testing frameworks to validate the performance and reliability of path planning algorithms.
Improve performance, reliability, scalability, and security for our drone backend systems, with a particular emphasis on ensuring safe and compliant drone operations.
Introduce tools and best practices to accelerate our drone development process and ensure adherence to aviation regulations.

We're excited about you because you have...

B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Robotics, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.
6+ years of industry experience as a software engineer, with a focus on backend systems, robotics, or autonomous systems.
Strong experience in developing and implementing algorithms for path planning.
Experience with simulations and testing frameworks for robotics or autonomous systems.
Experience with either Kotlin, or C++.
Ability to improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of distributed systems, especially in a real-time operational context.
Experience with service-oriented architecture, writing REST APIs, unit testing, and architectural design.
Understanding of networking and communication protocols relevant to robotics and IoT (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, MQTT).
Experience with SQL or NoSQL databases.
Familiarity with aviation regulations and safety standards (e.g., FAA Part 107) is a strong plus.

Nice to Have
Experience with these technologies is not required but helpful.

Familiarity with Kotlin
gRPC, Kafka, Redis, Postgres, or Cassandra
AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
Experience with ROS (Robot Operating System) or other robotics middleware
Familiarity with geospatial data and mapping technologies (GIS)

The Experiential & In-Store Marketing team is focused on building powerful, lasting relationships with our customers and prospects through meaningful, on-the-ground brand experiences. About the Role
Were looking for field marketing rockstars to take the lead in LA and Miami! Youll be a part of the growth marketing team and play a key role in executing high-impact regional programs that drive brand awareness, engagement, and pipeline in our priority markets. As the local face of DoorDash, youll support end-to-end event logistics for curated experiences, trade shows, and partner activationsmanaging vendors, timelines, and on-site execution. Youll work closely with Sales, Growth Marketing, Partnerships, and Brand to localize our global go-to-market strategy and make it resonate in-market. This includes executing account-based plays, customizing outreach materials, delivering field kits, tracking campaign impact, and activating the brand through local hospitality partnerships and customer advocacy.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

You are comfortable with marketing technologies (e.g., Salesforce, Marketo, Outreach) and driven by data and ROI.

Title: Senior Program Manager, Tech and Insights
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Technology and Insights team consists of People Technology, People Analytics, People Apps and Corporate IT teams. Its a team that, through our technology, services and products, touches every aspect of the employee lifecycle, with core people platforms like Workday and Greenhouse, custom people products, hardware and software distribution, IT service desk and everything in between. Were a global team, supporting our workforce in 35+ countries across the Americas, EMEA and APAC. Our obsession is providing world-class experiences to our users, through all the services and products we provide, providing continuous efficiencies through automation and cutting-end technology like AI. 
About the Role
Were looking for a Senior Program Manager, Tech & Insights to join our team. In the role, you will lead cross-functional teams to deliver complex technical implementations and change projects on time, within scope, and with high quality. You will bridge the gap between the technical and business teams, ensuring smooth execution of these technical programs and projects. You are responsible for managing timelines, risk mitigation, stakeholder communication, and ensuring the people are aligned with program goals (that are always rooted in business objectives). We are looking for an individual who is comfortable in a fast-paced, hands-on environment with an affinity for building from scratch.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Plan and Execute Key Projects: You will plan and execute on multiple complex technical projects simultaneously. You will manage a project life cycle from planning to launch, including requirements gathering, development, testing and deployment. 
Collaborate Cross-functionally: You will act as a bridge between technical teams and non-technical business stakeholders (e.g. HR, Finance, Payroll) and facilitate discussions and decisions, ensuring alignment with program goals and business priorities. You will coordinate and manage dependencies across teams (e.g., resourcing, timelines, and related priorities). You will manifest successful cross-functional relationships through formal project activities (e.g., governance, facilitated cross-functional decision making, core team leadership) as well as building, maintaining, and appropriately leveraging ongoing relationships across the enterprise that enable work to get done.
Manage Risks & Problem Solve: You will identify, track, and manage project risks and issues. You will find solutions and mitigation strategies to reduce project risks and ensure successful delivery, and driving problem resolution across cross-functional teams, escalating issues when necessary.
Exhibit clear communication & reporting: You will maintain clear and detailed documentation on project scope, requirements, specifications, and decisions. You will provide regular updates to stakeholders on project progress, risks, and roadblocks and deliver updates to leadership and other stakeholders on key project milestones and outcomes. 
Lead Cross-Functional Project Teams: You will guide cross-functional project teams towards achieving project goals (without org chart authority). 

Were excited about you because...

You have 7+ years of experience in technical program management or project management roles, with a proven track record of delivering large-scale technical projects in a fast-paced environment. You have exceptional project management skills, the ability to track and manage complex processes, and a desire to lead multiple teams and multiple projects at once. Experience in project management methodologies, especially Agile, is an advantage. You are comfortable and experienced adapting these methodologies to meet each team and projects needs.
You are experienced leading large scoping, design, and planning workshops or engagements with both technical and non-technical participants.
You are experienced building and maintaining detailed project documentation as a means to facilitate project progression  
You are proficient in project management tools (e.g., Jira, Asana, SmartSheets, Monday) as well as Google Sheets, Docs and Slides. 
Youre eager to solve complex problems in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment
You have excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels. 
You have a demonstrated track record of successful cross-functional leadership, collaboration, and relationship building.

The Strategic Sales team at DoorDash's In-Store division is on a mission to redefine and reshape the hospitality industry for restaurant operators around the globe. Title: Shift Lead - Edison
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Benefits

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Title: Head of Drone Maintenance
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs is an independent team within DoorDash. We explore robotics and automation to transform last-mile logistics in the long term. If you have a passion for applying autonomous aviation technologies in a service used by millions of people, then we want to talk to you!
About the Role
As the Director of Drone Maintenance, you will oversee all aspects of drone flight Maintenance, ensuring full compliance with FAA Part 135 regulations and company safety protocols. You will be responsible for managing all aircraft maintenance, repairs, inspections, and alterations of company operated aircraft and articles as assigned in accordance with policies and procedures. Youll ensure that company operational goals and objectives are met, while guaranteeing all aircraft maintenance documentation is maintained in compliance with applicable Federal Aviation Regulations, company policies and procedures, and applicable maintenance manuals.
You're excited about this opportunity because...

Regulatory Compliance:

Develop, implement, and oversee drone operations in compliance with FAA Part 135 regulations.
Thorough knowledge of the contents of Part 135 documentation and experience with writing and revising General Operations Manual (GOM) and Training Manuals
Ensure compliance with all FAA, DOT, and company policies and regulations.
Represent the company in regulatory discussions and industry events.

Maintenance Management:

Lead the Maintenance team through immense scaling
Develop and maintain the Continuous Airworthiness Maintenance Program (CAMP)
Maintain close contact with the Director of Operations to provide current aircraft status and forecast down times.
Oversee training programs for maintenance personnel.
Excited to be high touch with the operations team, observing Maintenance from the field

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Scaling:

Collaborate with engineering and technology teams to enhance fleet reliability and maintainability.
Work closely with our commercial operations lead, understanding what the commercial goals are and matching them to our current state of maintenance operations.



Be at the forefront of autonomous aviation and shape the future of last-mile drone delivery.
Lead a high-impact team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Work with industry leaders in delivery, logistics and autonomous aviation.
Build a team from the ground up with autonomy and trust.
Develop scalable workflows that ensure compliance, safety, and efficiency as operations expand.

We're excited about you because...

A&P-IA with experience maintaining aircraft and their maintenance records.
FAA Part 135 experience, including leadership in a commercial aviation or UAS environment.
Strong understanding of FAA regulations governing maintenance and record keeping under Part 135.

Bonus Qualifications

Experience with commercial drone delivery operations or UAS integration into logistics networks.
Prior involvement in obtaining and maintaining FAA Part 135 certification for UAS operations.
Strong technical understanding of autonomous flight systems and aviation software.

Title: Hardware Prototype Engineering Technician
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs is an independent team within DoorDash. We are working on building autonomous delivery robots from the ground up and other automation solutions as part of DoorDash's core delivery platform. If you have a passion for applying AI and robotics solutions in a service used by millions of people, then we want to talk to you!
About the Role
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Hardware Prototype Engineering Technician to join our team. In this hands-on role, you will help service and assemble the next generation of robotic systems within DoorDash Labs. You will own the end-to-end buildout of test platforms and be responsible for delivering complete test fixtures to internal and external customers. Youll work with a thoughtful, dynamic team of engineers to develop test systems, maintain shop operations, and contribute to a growing service and development capability for cutting-edge robotics.
Youll work closely with hardware and service engineering teams to tackle novel technical challenges in electromechanical systems and vehicle platforms. This is a role for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, hands-on environment and is passionate about building and refining robotic systems.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Assemble, repair, and troubleshoot complex electromechanical systems, including test platforms and robotic delivery vehicles
Own the end-to-end build and delivery of test fixtures and prototypes
Develop and create wiring harnesses, assemble compute systems, and integrate electronics and sensors
Perform root cause analysis, calibration, and diagnostics on vehicle and computer systems
Maintain a structured inventory and lab environment to ensure organization and efficiency
Manage procurement of key components and maintain relationships with suppliers
Collaborate closely with engineering to minimize downtime and optimize performance
Document detailed assembly procedures for future reference and repeatability
Regularly work at customer or field sites to support integration and testing

We're excited about you because you have...

5+ years of hands-on technical experience in mechanical, electrical, computer, automotive, or robotics industries
Demonstrated ability to assemble prototypes, build wiring harnesses, and follow engineering instructions precisely
Strong understanding of schematics, datasheets, and the ability to interpret them accurately
Experience soldering, crimping, and working with cable management in lab or shop environments
Proficiency with tools and equipment including 3D printers, diagnostic instruments, and common shop power tools and machinery
Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and solving difficult technical challenges
Excellent communication and organizational skills, with a strong ability to manage inventory systems
Willingness to work on-site with customers and in the field as needed

Bonus points if you have...

Familiarity with Python or other programming languages for automation or troubleshooting
Experience with Linux for robotic system testing and integration
Skills in manual machining, welding, or other fabrication techniques
Background in automotive repair or vehicle system maintenance
Experience working with AV hardware such as LiDARs, radars, and cameras
Ability to design and prototype custom wiring harnesses and understand harness drawings
Knowledge of CAD software such as Solidworks for 3D model navigation and design edits

About the Team
The Technical Support Engineering team at SevenRooms partners with teams across Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to resolve complex technical issues and ensure an exceptional client experience. We work at the intersection of technology and service, helping clients troubleshoot issues, implement solutions, and maximize the value of our platform. Our team is made up of curious problem-solvers with strong technical skills and a passion for hospitality.
About the Role
In this role, youll lead a team of Technical Support Engineers focused on resolving advanced product and integration issues. Youll oversee daily operations, manage escalated cases, and collaborate cross-functionally to deliver high-quality support. You have 46 years of experience in technical support or engineering roles, ideally within a B2B SaaS environment

Title: Manager, Global Talent Intelligence
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash & Wolts Global Talent Intelligence (GTI) function is a brand-new pillar inside Workforce Strategy & Recruiting Operations (RecOps). Our charter is simple but sweeping: turn external labor-market noise into crisp, actionable intelligence that helps TA, Finance, and business leaders hire the right talent, in the right place, at the right costfirst. We own everything outside the walls of DoorDash: competitor movement, supply-and-demand signals, location cost curves, skills trends, and employer-brand positioning.
About the Role
This role will require you to work out of an East Coast Time zone.
Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Workforce Strategy and Planning, the Manager, Global Talent Intelligence is our resident market-intelligence authority. You will design, run, and continuously improve the GTI programhands-on with the data, deep in the methodology, and shoulder-to-shoulder with partners and leaders across the Business, Recruiting, Finance, Compensation. You own the outside-in lens: real-time market monitoring, location benchmarking, and competitor talent analytics that directly upgrade Locations strategy, sourcing strategy and executive decision-making.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Shape an entirely new capability: build GTI from the ground up and own its long-term roadmap.
Turn data into decisions: create concise, compelling narratives that inform nine-figure labor-cost and location bets.
Own real-time market intelligence: track competitor moves, talent-supply shifts, and pay trends, surfacing insights that recruiters deploy immediately.
Drive location strategy: publish data-rich scorecards on where to open, scale, or consolidate global sites, partnering with Real Estate and Finance.
Coach and raise the bar: mentor analysts, set methodological standards, and foster a culture of curiosity and integrity in data use.
Embed intelligence in workflows: partner with People Analytics to weave external intel into dashboards, ATS, and recruiter playbooks.
Run the business cadence: lead weekly, monthly, and quarterly reviews; facilitate retros to keep methods sharp and insights relevant.
Operate on a global canvas: influence talent strategy across ~30 countriesand counting.

Were excited about you because you...

Bring 58 years in talent intelligence, labor-market research, or competitive intelligence, with a global lens.
Are a master storytellerable to distill complex datasets into executive-ready narratives and present confidently to VP/C-suite audiences.
Have proven vision-setting chopsyouve stood up new capabilities or programs and driven adoption across functions.
Possess strong market-data fluency with platforms like Lightcast, LinkedIn Talent Insights, Revelio, etc., and can guide analysts on best use.
Excel at consultative partnership, collaborating with Compensation, People Analytics, Finance, and TA to inform workforce decisions.
Demonstrate people-leadership skills, setting clear standards, coaching junior talent, and nurturing a high-integrity, high-impact culture.
Approach work with a continuous-improvement mindset, leveraging Lean/Kaizen principles to refine processes and deliverables.

Title: Associate Manager, Digital Ordering - Strategy & Operations
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Digital Ordering is DoorDashs first software-as-a-service business unit  offering a suite of services across online ordering, branded mobile apps, loyalty solutions, and more that enable restaurants to reach customers through their own first-party channels.
The business is one of the fastest-growing segments within DoorDash, and yet is only scratching the surface of a generational opportunity to better serve hundreds of thousands of merchants across the Americas to help them grow their business and improve working lives in one of the countrys biggest industry sectors.As part of the Strategy & Operations team focused on our restaurant segment, the Associate Manager will have the opportunity to help define and lead key strategic initiatives to grow the business. Your work will be instrumental to helping transition DoorDash from a consumer marketplace to an industry-leading B2B SaaS company.
On a typical day, youll work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Operations to grow our SaaS suite and drive merchant success. Youll design and test new GTM motions and synthesize insights from merchants and frontline teams to influence product and strategy. Whether youre running experiments, analyzing data to uncover growth levers, or building internal processes to help teams move faster together  youll be at the center of scaling what works.
About the Role
As an Associate Manager on the Digital Ordering Strategy & Operations team, youll be at the forefront of building DoorDashs SaaS business into a category-defining platform for restaurants. This role is ideal for a strategic operator who can move fast and wear many hats  equal parts analyst, builder, operator, and GTM partner.
Youll own zero-to-one experiments, craft growth strategies for our first-party products (ordering, websites, loyalty, mobile apps), and work directly with frontline sales and product teams to help merchants thrive. If you thrive in ambiguous environments, know how to test and scale new ideas, and want to help local businesses win, we want to hear from you.
Were especially excited about candidates whove worked in fast-moving, founder-led, or resource-constrained environments  those who see lack of structure as an opportunity to build.
Your responsibilities will include:

Grow the product line: Partner with Product, Marketing, and Sales to grow our first-party SaaS suite  spanning online ordering, websites, apps, and loyalty  by building high-impact enablement materials (pitch decks, sales plays, trainings), launching new GTM motions, and acting as the connective tissue across teams to ensure feedback loops inform strategy and product development.
Impact:  Act as the voice of the merchant and the field, synthesizing feedback from frontline Sales, Onboarding, Support, and Operations to help influence product roadmaps and GTM priorities. You'll ensure our solutions resonate with customers and scale with repeatable excellence.
Analyze:  Pair complex data analysis with qualitative insights from internal teams and customers to guide strategic decisions, GTM launches, and content development. Youll translate insight into action that improves both merchant experience and internal execution.
Experiment: Design and launch zero-to-one experiments that test new GTM motions and pilot AI-powered tools  building demos, prototype AI agents, or configure internal tooling that improves speed, accuracy, or effectiveness in go-to-market efforts.
Scale learnings:  Codify what works. Build repeatable frameworks, processes, and training to drive GTM excellence across the org. You'll define best practices for launching new products and motions in a way thats scalable and measurable.

The best candidates will:

Bring strong analytical horsepower and intellectual curiosity  you're comfortable diving into complex data and extracting insights that drive real-world decisions
Think like a founder  scrappy, resourceful, and driven to solve hard problems with limited structure or direction
Thrive in fast-paced, high-ambiguity environments  you move with urgency, default to action, take ownership end-to-end, and know when to bend process to get things done
Have experience working closely with Sales or frontline teams and know how to turn insights from those teams into action
Demonstrate comfort with AI, automation, or internal tooling to drive process efficiency, enable scale, or prototype solutions
Are relationship builders who foster deep trust and collaboration across functions - able to build strong relationships with our Sales, Account Management, Product, Engineering teams
Communicate clearly and adapt their message depending on audience  whether summarizing insights for leadership or rolling up sleeves with field teams

You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build deep and meaningful relationships with merchants, laser focused on helping them thrive
Imagine, develop, and execute on workstreams from start to completion with little oversight
Oscillate easily from strategic considerations to tactical execution
Operate comfortably in ambiguous environments while maintaining a strong bias for action
Communicate precisely dependent on audience and level of detail necessary to share
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional team members across the organization
Represent the DoorDash brand with humility and a customer-first mindset

We're excited about you because you...

46 years of experience in consulting, strategy, sales, revenue operations, GTM/growth, B2B SaaS roles, or on a platform team advising B2B SaaS companies
Proven ability to lead cross-functional initiatives  from identifying opportunities to executing with Product, Sales, and Marketing teams
Experience in high-growth or complex environments, with a track record of navigating ambiguity and driving outcomes
Strong analytical skills; advanced Excel required, SQL proficiency preferred
Exceptional written and verbal communication, with the ability to tailor messaging across audiences (e.g., sales reps, execs, and merchants)
Bachelor's degree required.

Bonus if you have experience with:

Piloting or working with AI tools in real-world workflows
Zero-to-one work (startups, early-stage teams, or founder-like roles)
Built GTM motions in restaurant or SMB SaaS
Are the first in your family to attend college

Title: Real Estate Portfolio Administrator
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Portfolio Administration team is a crucial function within the DoorDash Finance team that sits on the Workplace, Facilities and Real Estate organization. This team manages the overall operations of our facilities and the Portfolio Administration team is critical in ensuring all lease data is accurately abstracted, reported, and communicated.
About the Role
DoorDash is looking for a Real Estate Portfolio Administrator to report to the Associate Manager, Portfolio Administration. In this role, you will manage all lease obligations and support the scaling of our diverse real estate portfolio, as we expand and evolve to support our business. 
You will need to be a master at handling multiple tasks and projects with a no-job-is-too-small attitude, an ability to take thoughtful initiative, and the desire to go above and beyond. 
You will ensure compliance in lease reporting, auditing and approving lease abstractions, assist with portfolio planning, and other ongoing portfolio management activities to maintain accurate records utilizing systems and software in place. You will ensure data is reported accurately with the ability to generate, analyze, and distribute ad-hoc reports.
This role will require exceptional communication and organizational skills, strong attention to detail, resourcefulness, and the ability to work well with a diverse range of cross functional partners. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be a critical team member in the management of our expanding global portfolio, including tracking critical dates and driving strategic real estate decisions.
Review and approve new lease/amendment abstractions to ensure 100% accuracy in our lease database and administration system. 
Partner with our Construction Management team to review Construction timelines to ensure recovery of all TIA.
Work closely with Lease Accounting to ensure full sox and FASB 842 compliance. 
Work with Landlords, Transaction Management and Construction teams on assorted post-lease documentation including Commencement Date Agreements, Estoppels & SNDAs. 
Contact Landlord regarding maintenance and repair issues related to the building and common areas that are Landlord's responsibility under the Lease and monitor the progress.
Coordinate sublease projects with subTT and obtain Landlord approval.
Provide ownership responsibilities to all Cross Functional Partners (Facilities, Construction, Security, Lease Accounting)  per the Lease.
Work with legal to resolve interpretation discrepancies, and issue notices to Landlords.
Work with Lease Accounting to issue invoices applicable to the Lease language.
Interact with Landlords in order to facilitate completion of paperwork required under the Lease, and walk them through the provisions, if necessary.
Establish timely deadlines with the Landlord for self-help rights if not established in the lease and inform Facilities of expectations.
Monitor and collect reimbursements from Landlords for lease cap, self-help and security deposits.
Work alongside internal and external audit teams to ensure a seamless and successful audit process.
Foster strong relationships with cross-functional partners and ensure alignment across the organization.
Report and monitor Critical dates for lease/option renewals, terminations and other key milestones.
Partner and hold our third party vendor accountable to the reconciliation of monthly payments.
Partner with our third party vendor as needed to research and resolve payment disputes with Landlords.
Liaise with multiple teams; Real Estate Transaction, Lease Accounting, Facilities, Construction,  Legal, Procurement, Risk & Insurance and our third party team.
Support the preparation of monthly portfolio metric reporting.
Support special projects and assignments as required.
Develop and maintain process playbooks.
Review and audit CAM reconciliations.

Were excited about you because you...

Are Customer Obsessed with a passionate drive to, take initiative, and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.
Think big, and Start Small with a thoughtful process of analyzing data and circumstances to solve problems and reach a well-reasoned solution.
Value our One Team, One Fight mentality by partnering effectively to execute on our common goals in a pleasant and energetic manner.
Have a Bias for Action with an appreciation and understanding of our mission in order to make sound, timely contributions.
Strive to be 1% Better Everyday with your openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.
Choose Optimism and Have a Plan, whether it's a big project or impromptu task, you are quick on your feet and happy to contribute in a helpful, organized way.
Be an owner, no problem is too big, too small or outside of your scope. You always jump in and help.
Operate at the lowest level of detail, You are a detail-oriented individual who thrives on managing deadlines and accurately performing your work. 
Have a strong understanding of lease agreements, terminology, lease accounting principles. 
Have 3+ years of experience managing a global real estate portfolio. You bring expertise and understanding of commercial leases including extensive exposure to office and commercial portfolios. 
Have a bachelors degree or equivalent work experience
Expertise in understanding and interpreting complex lease language and CAM charges
Proficiency with lease database tools
Understanding of legal terminology as it pertains to leases and real estate
Ability to understand, abstract, and communicate lease requirements to stakeholders
Excellent written, verbal, analytical, and research skills required
Salesforce, Smartsheets, LeaseCalc, Google Suite experience a plus 

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are strategic - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. 
We are learning - Were not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if its scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if weve been in a role for one year or one minute.
We are customer-obsessed - We are committed to our clients and connected through our vision of Delivering Good
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

You will be proud to say that you work for DoorDash and will know that the work you do brings joy to our clients every day
